description: From Old French enfranchir (“to set free, enfranchise”), from en- (“in”) + franchir (“to set free”).

verbs.description: enfranchise (third-person singular simple present enfranchises, present participle enfranchising, simple past and past participle enfranchised)

definitionGroups.group: To grant the franchise to an entity, specifically:

entries.meaning: To grant the privilege of voting to a person or group of people.
To grant municipal or parliamentary rights to an entity such as a city or constituency.
To grant freedom from slavery, duty or servitude.
(property law, England & Wales, historical) to convert a copyhold estate into a freehold estate
